H0.text: The universe is constantly growing and changing is a characteristic of the steady state theory of the universe.

H1.text: A great explosion caused the origin of the universe is a characteristic of the steady state theory of the universe.

H2.text: The nature of the universe has always been the same is a characteristic of the steady state theory of the universe.

H3.text: Light moving from the center of the universe appears red is a characteristic of the steady state theory of the universe.

A4.text: The steady-state model adheres to the perfect cosmological principle, which states that the observable universe is always the same at any time and any place.

A5.text: The steady-state model does not predict a finite age of the universe, unlike the Big Bang theory.
